channel.title: I hate static shit

item.title: I hate static shit
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I need to use static, and EclipseRSPS, you were wrong.

What is also bull shit is that these voids aren’t even static

addExperience, deleteItem, addItem. Wtf? They are just public voids!

[code]Compiling…
src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:372: error: non-sta
tic method getOre() cannot be referenced from a static context
if (!player.getInventory().contains(OreToBar.getOre(), 1
)) {
^
src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:385: error: non-sta
tic method getCoal() cannot be referenced from a static context
player.getInventory().deleteItem(453, OreToBar.getCoal()
); //Coal
^
src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:386: error: non-sta
tic method getOre() cannot be referenced from a static context
player.getInventory().deleteItem(OreToBar.getOre(), 1);
//Ores
^
src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:394: error: non-sta
tic method getBar() cannot be referenced from a static context
player.getInventory().addItem(OreToBar.g
etBar(), 1);
^
src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:395: error: non-sta
tic method getExp() cannot be referenced from a static context
player.getSkills().addExperience(13, Ore
ToBar.getExp() / 2);

 ^

src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:396: error: non-sta
tic method getExp() cannot be referenced from a static context
player.getSkills().addExperience(6, OreT
oBar.getExp() / 2);

^

6 errors
Complete.
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: I hate static shit
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

public static enum OreToBar {
		
        BRONZE(436, 438, 2349, 0, 0),
        IRON(440, -1, 2351, 0, 0),
        SILVER(442, -1, 2355, 0, 0),
        GOLD(444, -1, 2357, 0, 0),
        STEEL(440, 453, 2353, 2, 0),
        MITHRIL(447, 453, 2359, 4, 0),
        ADAMANTITE(449, 453, 2361, 6, 0),
        RUNITE(451, 453, 2363, 8, 0);

	private int ore, ore2, exp, bar, coalAmount;
	
	private OreToBar(int ore, int ore2, int bar, int coalAmount, int exp) {
	        this.ore = ore;
	        this.ore2 = ore2;
	        this.bar = bar;
	        this.coalAmount = coalAmount;
	        this.exp = exp;
	}
    public int getOre2() {
            return ore2;
    }
    
    public int getCoal() {
            return coalAmount;
    }
    
    public int getBar() {
            return bar;
    }
    
    public int getOre() {
            return ore;
    }
    
    public int getExp() {
            return exp;
    }

Shouldn’t be using static that way, if I’m not mistaken.

Read full topic

item.title: I hate static shit
item.dc:creator: @EclipseRSPS EclipseRSPS
item.description:
@EclipseRSPS wrote:

[code]public static enum OreToBar {
BRONZE(436, 438, 2349, 0, 0),
IRON(440, -1, 2351, 0, 0),
SILVER(442, -1, 2355, 0, 0),
GOLD(444, -1, 2357, 0, 0),
STEEL(440, 453, 2353, 2, 0),
MITHRIL(447, 453, 2359, 4, 0),
ADAMANTITE(449, 453, 2361, 6, 0),
RUNITE(451, 453, 2363, 8, 0);

    private static int ore;
    private static int ore2;
    private static int exp;
    private static int bar;
    private static int coalAmount;

    public static OreToBar(int ore, int ore2, int bar, int coalAmount, int exp) {
            this.ore = ore;
            this.ore2 = ore2;
            this.bar = bar;
            this.coalAmount = coalAmount;
            this.exp = exp;
    }
            public static int getOre2() {
                    return ore2;
            }
            
            public static int getCoal() {
                    return coalAmount;
            }
            
            public static int getBar() {
                    return bar;
            }
            
            public static int getOre() {
                    return ore;
            }
            
            public static int getExp() {
                    return exp;
            }
    [/code]

try.

item.title: I hate static shit
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Yesterday I had some problems with the static stuff and I have changed all my enum crap to static except the private OreToOre.

I get this error. I need to get this fixed and I will just get my java knowledge to 4/10 (lol)

Compiling... src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:334: error: illegal reference to static field from initializer this.ore = ore; ^ src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:335: error: illegal reference to static field from initializer this.ore2 = ore2; ^ src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:336: error: illegal reference to static field from initializer this.bar = bar; ^ src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:337: error: illegal reference to static field from initializer this.coalAmount = coalAmount; ^ src\org\dementhium\net\packethandlers\ItemOnItemHandler.java:338: error: illegal reference to static field from initializer this.exp = exp; ^ 5 errors Complete. Press any key to continue . . .

[code=java]public static enum OreToBar {
BRONZE(436, 438, 2349, 0, 0),
IRON(440, -1, 2351, 0, 0),
SILVER(442, -1, 2355, 0, 0),
GOLD(444, -1, 2357, 0, 0),
STEEL(440, 453, 2353, 2, 0),
MITHRIL(447, 453, 2359, 4, 0),
ADAMANTITE(449, 453, 2361, 6, 0),
RUNITE(451, 453, 2363, 8, 0);

private static int ore, ore2, bar, coalAmount, exp;

private OreToBar(int ore, int ore2, int bar, int coalAmount, int exp) {
	this.ore = ore;
	this.ore2 = ore2;
	this.bar = bar;
	this.coalAmount = coalAmount;
	this.exp = exp;
}
	public static int getOre2() {
		return ore2;
	}
	public static int getCoal() {
		return coalAmount;
	}
	public static int getBar() {
		return bar;
	}
	public static int getOre() {
		return ore;
	}
	public static int getExp() {
		return exp;
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic
